intro: Persoonia coriacea, commonly known as the rough persoonia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, leathery leaves. The plant produces clusters of yellow to orange flowers that bloom in spring, attracting nectar-feeding birds and insects. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to harsh, arid environments. Persoonia coriacea is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
